isis.stitle: RECONDITIONING BRAKE DRUMS AND SHOES - REPLACING LINING/BLOCKS

svcproc.title: REMOVAL

step1.para: Remove lining/blocks. If lining/blocks are riveted, use a suitable riveting mandrel to push out rivets.

caution.para: Drilling out rivets or cutting off upset head with a chisel may cause rivet hole elongation.

step1.para: If blocks are bolted, remove using suitable tools.

svcproc.para: Discard used lock washers. Use new washers when installing new lining. Replace bolts and nuts if signs of distortion or wear are present.

After the old linings are removed from the shoes, the shoes should be cleaned and buffed to remove all dirt and grease. Grease is one of the greatest deteriorating agents of lining. Paint with rust inhibitive paint.
